page.title: 18Farming-Rawdon + Horsforth 2
page.content: {Local History-}Much of the farmland in the area belonged to a mere handful of families.The Craven family were landowners until 1941.They were in fact tanners.Tanhouse cottage still exists near Scotland Beck.The Inghams lived in the area and their descendants,the Pullans still do.The Pullans had built up a thriving flax bleaching works but this suffered at the end of the 19thC.as linen was replaced by cotton.The Stanhope family also owned much estate in the Bayton area.Their land adjoined that of the Rathmell family in Rawdon.Most of the farmland was reclaimed moorland.Much of the farming area(probably 10%)has been lost since 1931 to the Leeds Bradford Airport.There are two extensive golf courses,and a great deal of housing development in the area.
